intro: Cynoglossum creticum, commonly known as the Crete bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Crete. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing a preference for well-drained soils. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Cynoglossum creticum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
